result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin H Votaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Invade Privacy - Use Surveillance Device, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(a).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.  Credit for 13 days.  To be served in Wisconsin State Prison.

Court costs and victim witness surcharges plus the mandatory $500.00 surcharge for possessing child porn.  To be paid by 10/28/2025.  DOC to collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommende treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

No alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with Christina S., Dana P., E.T. dob 8/1/2006; E.T. dob April 2005.
Defendant is not to have any unsupervised contact with his biological children.  Court advised defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.

Successfully complete a Cognitive  Thinking Behavioral Modification course; and a parenting course.
Sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 10-28-2015 received and filed. (52 Pages.)
Count two.
Count one.
Amended PSI filed.

Defendant Justin H Votaw in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Corrections made to the Presentence Report. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional Statements by: Dana P.
AS TO COUNT 1:
 The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 2, with credit for 13 days time served. Sentence to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 13 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges plus the mandatory $500 surcharge for possessing child porn,  are to be paid by 10/28/2025, DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10/28/2025, DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Work or school
-Successfully complete a parenting course
-No contact with Christina S, Dana P, ET (dob 8/1/2006), ET (dob April 2005); Defendant is not to have any unsupervised contact with his biological children. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
-Sex Offender evaluation and any recommended treatment
*Defendant to Register with the Sex Offender Registry
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Justin H Votaw in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court ordered a presentence report without a recommendation at the defense request. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 10/2/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15. Court ordered that the defendant not travel outside of Wisconsin and defendant is not to depart out of the United States.
The State filed an amended complaint changing the date in Count 2 to "on or about April 15, 2015".

Defendant Justin H Votaw in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State filed an amended information changing the date in Count 2 to "on or about April 15, 2015".

Defendant Justin H Votaw in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State's oral motion for joinder with 15CF2228 heard; defense has no objection to joinder.  Motion for joinder is GRANTED.
Court directs that all discovery must be completed by 7-1-2015.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-6-2015 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 8-31-2015 at 8:30am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 7-16-2015.  
 All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Justin H Votaw in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Justin H Votaw in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.

05/07/2015
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dana P.; LKK; EJT; Jamie T.; Cristina S.; KV or HV

Defendant Justin H Votaw in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Justin H Votaw in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 1.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
